alert.note: Alert for Forest; Langlade; Shawano; Waupaca; Waushara (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 16 at 10:52AM CDT until April 17 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A SIGNIFICANT ROUND OF WINTRY PRECIPITATION EXPECTED TONIGHT INTO MONDAY... .Low pressure will strengthen over northeast Wisconsin today and tonight, then begin to drift east into Michigan on Monday. Colder air wrapping south on the western flank of the system will cause the rain to change to a wintry mix over north-central and central Wisconsin late today and this evening. Periods of heavy snow are likely tonight into Monday. The snow will be mixed with some sleet and freezing rain at times. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Rain changing to a wintry mix of snow, sleet, and freezing rain. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 6 inches, with the highest totals across the western portion of the advisory area. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Waushara, Langlade, Forest, Shawano, and Waupaca Counties. * WHEN...From 7 PM this evening to 1 PM CDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions will develop tonight and continue into Monday morning, including for the morning commute.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
